how_to_read: This file is a JSON report produced by run_smoke/run_smoke.ps1.
ok=true means all checks passed; ok=false means at least one step failed and error contains the message.
steps[] contains timing per step (ms). payload contains the API responses captured during the smoke.

fields.base_url: Backend base URL used for requests (Django).
fields.company_id: Company id used for dashboard checks.
fields.obligation_id: Obligation id toggled via PATCH true/false.
fields.ok: Overall result. true=all assertions passed; false=failed.
fields.payload: Captured API payloads used in the checks (dashboard, spa dashboard, after patch true/false).

step_names.server_check: Verifies the backend server is reachable on base_url (port open). If AutoStartServer was enabled, it may start runserver automatically.
step_names.get_dashboard: GET /api/companies/<company_id>/dashboard/ ; asserts required keys exist and stats invariants hold.
step_names.get_spa_dashboard: GET /api/companies-spa/<company_id>/dashboard/ ; asserts it is canonical-JSON-equal to get_dashboard (same data for HTML/API/SPA).
step_names.patch_true: PATCH /api/obligations/<obligation_id>/status/ with {is_compliant:true}; asserts the item moves from todo -> completed and stats stay consistent.
step_names.patch_false: PATCH /api/obligations/<obligation_id>/status/ with {is_compliant:false}; asserts the item moves from completed -> todo and stats stay consistent.

payload_schema.payload.after_true: Dashboard-like response returned after marking an obligation complete.
payload_schema.payload.after_false: Dashboard-like response returned after reverting an obligation to open.

invariants_checked: payload from dashboard endpoint equals payload from SPA dashboard endpoint (after canonicalization)
After PATCH true, obligation_id must appear in completed and not in todo; after PATCH false vice versa.
